#Text=Ambrosius Benson
#Text=Ambrosius Benson 's The Magdalen Reading , c. 1525 .
#Text=Ambrosius Benson ( c. 1495/1500 , in Ferrara or Milan [ 1 ] – 1550 , in Flanders ) was an Italian painter who became a part of the Northern Renaissance .
#Text=While many surviving paintings have been attributed , there is very little known of him from records , and he tended not to sign his work .
#Text=He is believed to be responsible for mainly religious art , but also painted portraits on commission .
#Text=He sometime painted from classical sources , often setting the figures in modern-dress , or a contemporary domestic setting . [ 2 ]
#Text=In his lifetime he was successful ; he had a large workshop , his work was sold internationally and he was especially popular in Spain . [ 3 ]
#Text=Benson became popular as a source for pastiche with 19th-century painters , who are sometimes known as the " followers of Benson " .

column1: #Text=In particular his many variations of the Magdalen and Sibilla Persica were further copied and became popular with contemporary buyers .
#Text=Life
#Text=Death of Lucretia , date unknown .
#Text=The rape that lead to Lucretia 's suicide can be seen in the background .

#Text=Although Ambrosius Benson ( or Ambrose Benzone , as he is named by an early scholar in deference to his Lombardian origin ) was Italian by birth , scholars consider him a painter of the Flemish school . [ 4 ]
#Text=Typical of the itinerant manner of many painters of the time , he moved to Bruges c. 1515 and served his apprenticeship with the Early Netherlandish painter Gerard David .
#Text=He later became a naturalized citizen of Bruges . [ 3 ]
#Text=Benson worked as a journeyman before he was made master in 1519 and became a member of the guild of painters and saddle makers . [ 5 ]
#Text=He eventually became a dean and then a governor of the guild .
#Text=He married Anna Ghyselin , and had two sons with her , Jan and Willem , both of whom became painters .
#Text=He later remarried and had a daughter Anna .
#Text=He is believed to have had at least two other daughters from extramarital affairs .

#Text=Benson came into dispute with Gerard around 1519 , over a number of paintings and drawings Benson had created -including a book of studies for heads and nudes as well as various patterns- in the older master 's workshop without his assistance .
#Text=David refused to return the material , and after Benson pursued him legally , served time in prison for his appropriation . [ 6 ] [ 7 ]
#Text=Late 19th-century version of one of his Sibilla Persica paintings , showing a half-length female reading a book held in her hands . [ 8 ]
#Text=He served as head of the Guild of Saint Luke from 1537 to 1539 and 1543 to 1544 .
#Text=Much of his work was at one time attributed to a Spanish artist known only as the Master of Segovia ; it is now believed they were the same person .
#Text=Perhaps under the influence of Rogier van der Weyden 's 15th-century The Magdalen Reading , Benson was one of the first artists to popularise images of women reading .
#Text=It became a motif for him , and he painted the scene many times in his images of Mary Magdalen and the Sybil Persica , whom he treated as almost interchangeable . [ 8 ]
#Text=One The Magdalen Reading by Benson is held in the National Gallery , London . [ 9 ]
#Text=Gallery
